newsitem.title: KENYA: Kenya shilling ends firmer against dollar, pound.
newsitem.headline: Kenya shilling ends firmer against dollar, pound.

text.p: The Kenyan shilling strengthened further against the dollar and other major international currencies on Thursday in active trading, dealers said.
The Central Bank of Kenya posted a shilling mean rate of 56.07 to the dollar from 56.135 on Wednesday, and 87.54 to the pound against 87.81.
A commercial banker said inflows from exporters continued to boost the local unit despite high demand for hard currencies.
"A significant increase in interbank activities reflected the volatility in interbank trade as the shilling consolidated further," a commercial dealer said.
"The market opened at 56.05/20, but soon shifted to 55.90/00 as large exporter sales of dollars hit the market," she said.

One banker said speculation was partly responsible for the shilling's gain. "However, the local unit failed to clearly break through the 56 barrier, predominantly because of central bank intervention," he added.
Dealer said the overnight money market was tight. Rates were still above the 20 percent level.
